conclusion: Analyze the relationship between velocity and displacement as depicted in the diagram.
The graph plots reciprocal of velocity on the y-axis and displacement on the x-axis.
The graph is a straight line with a positive slope, indicating a linear relationship between reciprocal of velocity and displacement.
Reciprocal of velocity is inversely proportional to velocity, so if reciprocal of velocity increases, velocity decreases.
The positive slope of the line indicates that as displacement increases, reciprocal of velocity also increases.
Since reciprocal of velocity is increasing, the velocity must be decreasing.
A decreasing velocity implies that the particle is slowing down as it moves along the displacement.
Deceleration is defined as a decrease in velocity over time.
Since the velocity is decreasing with increasing displacement, the particle is undergoing deceleration.
